headlines.description: Chelsea bounced back into contention for next season's Champions League with a 1-0 home win over Everton in the Premier League on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea beat Everton to reignite UCL hopes

events.name: West Ham United at Brighton & Hove Albion

headlines.description: Brighton & Hove Albion's Kaoru Mitoma and Carlos Baleba struck late goals in a thrilling 3-2 Premier League victory over West Ham United.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brighton win thriller with Mitoma, Baleba goals

headlines.description: Ipswich Town were relegated from the Premier League on Saturday following a 3-0 defeat away to Newcastle United.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ipswich relegated after 3-0 loss at Newcastle

headlines.description: Fulham came from behind to beat Southampton 2-1 in the Premier League on Saturday to claim three precious points in their chase for European football.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fulham leave it late to beat Southampton 2-1

headlines.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers extended their remarkable winning run to six Premier League games as Matheus Cunha scored one goal and set up two others.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cunha stars in sixth successive win for Wolves

headlines.description: Rasmus Højlund scored an equaliser deep into stoppage time as Manchester United salvaged a 1-1 away draw at 10-man Bournemouth on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Højlund saves Man Utd at 10-man Bournemouth

headlines.description: Liverpool roared back from a goal behind to thrash Tottenham Hotspur 5-1 and wrap up the Premier League title in style on a momentous day at Anfield on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool thrash Tottenham to secure Prem title

headlines.description: Nottingham Forest missed out on a chance to move into the top three in the Premier League, and strengthen hopes of a Champions League berth next season, as Brentford upset them 2-0 in their Premier League clash on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brentford deal blow to Forest's UCL ambitions

headlines.description: Kevin De Bruyne scored in his penultimate game at Etihad Stadium as Manchester City beat Wolves 1-0 on Friday to boost their chances of Champions League qualification.
headlines.shortLinkText: De Bruyne keeps Man City on track for UCL place

headlines.description: Youri Tielemans headed the only goal as Aston Villa beat Fulham 1-0 on Saturday to boost their hopes of finishing in the Premier League's top five.
headlines.shortLinkText: Villa earn vital win over Fulham in top-five battle

headlines.description: Everton's emotional farewell to Goodison Park continued on Saturday with an entertaining 2-2 Premier League draw against Ipswich Town as the relegated visitors came from two goals down to rescue a point.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ipswich fightback to draw 2-2 at Everton

headlines.description: Leicester City's Jamie Vardy and Jordan Ayew scored their team's first goals at the King Power Stadium in five months to secure a 2-0 Premier League victory over fellow relegated side Southampton on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Leicester end home drought in Southampton win

headlines.description: Bournemouth came from behind to win away at Arsenal for the first time in their history, with Evanilson's scrappy goal giving the Cherries a 2-1 victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bournemouth seal first-ever win at Arsenal

events.name: Newcastle United at Brighton & Hove Albion
Tottenham Hotspur at West Ham United

headlines.description: Chelsea will try to move closer to UEFA Champions League qualification on Sunday when the team hosts a Liverpool side coming off the high of clinching the league title in front of its home fans.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea, league titlist Liverpool set for clash

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Wolverhampton Wanderers
West Ham United at Manchester United
